titleStmt.title: The Fryer well-fitted. Or, A pretty j[e]st that once befell, how a maid put a fryer to cool in the well. To a pretty tune.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A84923 of text R177274 in the English Short Title Catalog (Wing F2207A). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: The Fryer well-fitted. Or, A pretty j[e]st that once befell, how a maid put a fryer to cool in the well. To a pretty tune.

publicationStmt.publisher: For F. Coles, T. Vere, and J. Wright,

notesStmt.note: Letter in title did not print.
Caption of second sheet reads: The second part, to the smae [sic] tune.
Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library.
